intro: Thylacitis compressa, commonly known as the narrow-leaved thylacine, is a species of flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea tree species. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, white or pale pink flowers. It is typically found in coastal regions and sandy soils, often growing in dense shrublands. Thylacitis compressa is adapted to withstand dry conditions and is an important part of the local flora in its native habitat.
